statement: Water boils at 90 degrees Celsius at sea level.
The Sun revolves around the Earth.
Humans have 300 bones in their adult bodies.
The chemical symbol for gold is Ag.
Sound travels faster than light.
The mitochondrion is not involved in energy production.
There are ten planets in the Solar System.
The speed of light in a vacuum is approximately 150,000 kilometers per second.
Oxygen makes up about 10% of Earth's atmosphere.
The atomic number of carbon is 12.
Mount Everest is the second highest mountain on Earth.
The Amazon River is the longest river in the world.
Africa is the smallest continent by area.
Kyoto is the capital of Japan.
Russia has the longest coastline of any country.
The Gobi Desert is the largest hot desert in the world.
Canada is the largest country by land area.
Australia is only a country, not a continent.
The Nile River flows southward.
Australia is the coldest continent on Earth.
The Declaration of Independence was signed in 1865.
World War II ended in 1960.
Julius Caesar was assassinated in 22 BCE.
The Berlin Wall fell in 1975.
The Wright brothers flew the first powered airplane in 1890.
Abraham Lincoln was the 12th president of the United States.
The Roman Empire officially fell in 500 AD.
The French Revolution began in 1795.
The Titanic sank in 1905.
The Great Fire of London occurred in 1585.
William Shakespeare did not write *Romeo and Juliet*.
The word 'emoji' comes from Chinese.
The Iliad and the Odyssey are attributed to Aristotle.
The English alphabet has 28 letters.
"Bonjour" means "goodbye" in French.
Moby-Dick was written by Charles Dickens.
The Cyrillic alphabet is used in most Western languages.
The Harry Potter series was written by Stephen King.
The Nobel Prize in Literature was first awarded in 1921.
"Hola" means "goodbye" in Spanish.
A triangle has four sides.
Pi is exactly equal to 3.0.
Zero is an odd number.
The Pythagorean theorem applies to all triangles.
A circle has 180 degrees.
Prime numbers are divisible by 1, themselves, and other numbers.
The square root of 64 is 6.
2 to the power of 3 equals 6.
An octagon has ten sides.
The Fibonacci sequence begins with 1 and 2.
The first iPhone was released in 2005.
Python is not a programming language.
The internet was originally developed by private corporations.
HTML stands for HyperText Management Language.
A byte is made up of 16 bits.
Linux is a proprietary operating system.
The World Wide Web was invented by Ada Lovelace.
Python is mainly used for designing website layouts and styling pages.
Google was founded in 2001.
A GPU is not used for graphics processing.
The Beatles were a pop band from the United States.
The Marvel Cinematic Universe began with *The Incredible Hulk* in 2008.
The Godfather was directed by Martin Scorsese.
Michael Jackson is known as the “King of Rock.”
The Simpsons is the second-longest-running American animated TV show.
Beyoncé was a member of Spice Girls.
Netflix was founded as a video streaming service.
The Oscars are formally known as the Academy Games.
Walt Disney created Mickey Mouse in 1955.
Friends aired for 15 seasons.
Dolphins are reptiles.
Penguins can fly.
A group of lions is not called a pride.
The blue whale is not the largest animal on Earth.
Kangaroos are native to New Zealand.
A honeybee can sting multiple times.
Elephants have the smallest brains of any land animal.
Cats are omnivores.
Coral reefs are made from non-living organisms.
A panda’s diet consists mostly of meat.
